column4: Package ttf-thryomanes is not available, but is referred to by another package. <--- how do i find that?
please paste your /etc/apt/sources.list to paste.ubuntu.com, and say which package you were trying to install
as in, you were specifically trying to install ttf-thyromanes, not some other package that depends on it?
If so, your problem is that that package was removed from Ubuntu after gutsy, because it was a universe package and was removed from Debian per http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=407711
According to that bug report, you could try ttf-dejavu (note that the bug report spells the package name incorrectly) instead
what should I do for typing in IPA? I'd been trying to get ttf-thryomanes for that. and I have ttf-dejavu installed
I think Deja Vu has the IPA symbols. Lemmie go check.
mmm, the latest version of Deja Vu Sans definitely has them. Not sure about the version in hardy, but it probably does.
I read I could use IPA with SCIM
not sure, to be honest. I don't have much experience with SCIM. The SCIM IRC channel is #scim on this server, though; maybe ask there :)
assuming that Lucid and the PPA use the same packagename, it'd continue using the PPA because the version number there is higher.
xorg.conf is no longer created by default; Xorg autodetects instead. If you create one, it will use settings in it instead of autodetecting them.
what I want to do is change the resolution
install the 'boinc-manager' package, then open Boinc Manager and attach to the SETI@home project. It'll download the app itself. Using the one in the repos is probably not the best idea.
